I don't give a lot of negative reviews not do I type in all caps much, but this app however, required a more direct approach. Philip's took a wonderfully functional, not without flaws but functional, and gave us this. The new app is convoluted, with many flaws. To list a small few : - Control of individual lights is much more difficult. I don't always want every light in a room on. - The entire concept of the "scenes" is poorly executed and not useful. - Setup and modification of add-on switches and controls is beyond bad. store I'll stop there because I have better things to do with my day than audit a horrible app. It's really telling when the gen 1 version of the app has a 3.6 rating in the store currently, while the "upgrade" is at 2.9. Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: I updated my rating to 4 stars because I find I use this app the most over other Hue apps. It's fast and simple and deserves recognition for that. Given that there are many different apps, all of which seem to specialize in different areas with no one single app providing EVERYTHING that you would want, this fits into the tool set usefully. The Philips Hue app controls adding lights, naming them, assigning them to groups with relative ease. It handles updates to firmware and addition of accessories like the motion detector and dimmer switches more easily than other apps. It does *not* do color management or preset management well. If you are listening, Philips, I would love to have better preset management and ways to set up triggers and animations, using your accessories. The motion detector desperately needs a way to set end time. Better integration with IFTTT too. There are apps on iOS which do creative things like animations that no Android app seems to handle well. But overall, this is a fine basic app. I use it for simple things, quickly, and it is fine.

Text: This is the first time I have ever left a review for a product. But, I felt so strongly that I was compelled to write, as I hope if enough people complain Philips will take notice. The app is useless. I have to use a third party app (Hue Pro) to control my lights. It is bad when an outsider does a better job at interacting with your product then your own app does. I recently purchased a motion sensor to accompany to my lights. However, I have to go through the official app to add it to my system, as I didn't see a way to do it in the 3rd-party app. I am stuck in a never ending loop of "An Update Is Available for your Hue Bridge". After watching it, rather unsuccessfully, look like it was partially installing the update, I get the message that an error occurred and to try again. And not just once, but DOZENS of times. Just when it appears that all is not lost (and the app tells me that the update is successful), I click DONE and and it informs me that an update is available. Hmmmm. Weird, I just installed a freaking update like five times!!! Today! And of course, there is no way to bypass this screen so that I can interact with my system. Conclusion: unless you love being frustrated, staring at the same screen over and over and have tons of time to waste, then you should find another app (like Hue Pro) to use for your bulbs. Just know that adding accessories to your system is also going to be a pain. If the app doesn't get better, I will never buy another bulb or accessory from Philips. Isn't the point to make life easier? Not make it infuriating.
